If passed, HB 2178 would allow people as young as 18 years old to legally gamble in Oregon’s casinos, tribal casinos and on the state’s lottery. It would also legalize sports betting and online gambling in the state.

Oregon is one of just a handful of states that has a legal gambling age of 21. The majority of states have a legal gambling age of 18 or 19 years old.

Supporters of the bill say that it will help create jobs and increase revenue for the state. They argue that young adults are already gambling illegally, so it makes sense to regulate and tax the industry.

Critics of the bill argue that gambling can be addictive and harmful to young people. They say that casino and lottery operators are more likely to prey on minors if the legal gambling age is lowered.

The fate of Oregon House Bill no. 2178 remains uncertain, but the debate over whether to lower the legal gambling age is sure to continue.

Chief Wants Michigan to Join At-Home Gaming Revolution

In the early days of video gaming, players would gather at each other’s homes to play games like Super Mario Bros. or Sonic the Hedgehog on their televisions. That soon changed with the rise of online gaming and gamers being able to play with people from all over the world.

Now, one Michigan police chief is pushing for a return to those home-gathering days, as he believes they could help fight crime.

Flint Police Chief Tim Johnson said in a recent interview that at-home gaming can provide a “sense of community” that is often missing from an individual’s life. He added that such gatherings can also help teach children about conflict resolution and etiquette.

Johnson’s comments come as the popularity of esports – competitive video gaming – continues to grow. According to market research firm NewZoo, the global esports audience will reach 380 million this year, with revenues approaching $1 billion. In the United States, 137 million people will watch or participate in esports in some way this year.

Michigan is already seeing some of this growth, with Grand Rapids hosting the first-ever state high school championships for League of Legends – one of the most popular esports games – earlier this year. The event drew nearly 2,000 spectators and more than 100 teams from across the state.

While many parents may be hesitant to allow their children to spend hours in front of a screen, Johnson believes that gaming can actually be good for them.

“I think that there’s a lot of good that comes out of video gaming, if it’s used in an appropriate way,” he said. “It can teach kids how to win and lose graciously; it can teach them how to work together as a team; it can teach them strategy.”

Some States Consider Allowing Gambling at Age 18, but Most Keep the Current Law

In the United States, each state decides its own minimum gambling age. Most states have set the minimum age at 21, but some states are considering allowing gambling at 18.

The primary argument for lowering the minimum gambling age is that individuals who are legally allowed to drink alcohol and smoke cigarettes should also be able to gamble. The opponents of this argument say that gambling can be more addictive than alcohol or cigarettes and that young people are not ready to handle the potential risks associated with gambling.

Some studies have shown that people under the age of 21 are more likely to develop a problem with gambling than adults over the age of 21. However, other studies have shown that there is no significant difference in the rates of addiction between young people and adults.

There is evidence that reducing the minimum gambling age can lead to increased revenue for casinos and state governments. However, there is also evidence that young people who gamble are more likely to experience financial problems than adults.

Ultimately, each state decides its own minimum gambling age. While some states are considering lowering the minimum age to 18, most states have set the minimum age at 21.

Post.title: You May Have to Pay Taxes on Your Winnings from Social Security
Post._content:
#  You May Have to Pay Taxes on Your Winnings from Social Security

If you receive Social Security benefits and happen to win a significant amount of money from gambling, the IRS may want its share in taxes.

Gambling winnings are taxable, no matter the amount. In fact, even if you don't itemize your deductions on your tax return, you must still report your gambling winnings. This means that whether you won $10 or $10,000 at the casino, that money is considered taxable income.

The good news is that there is a way to reduce the amount of tax you owe on your gambling winnings. The bad news is that this only applies to gambling losses incurred during the year. You can't simply go back and claim losses from years ago.

If you have net losses from gambling of more than $3,000 for the year, you can deduct those losses from your other income on your tax return. This can help offset some of the taxes you owe on your gambling winnings. However, it's important to note that you can only deduct losses up to the amount of your winningsover $3,000. If you have $4,000 in net gambling losses for the year but only $2,000 in gambling winnings, you can only deduct $2,000 worth of losses from your other income.

It's also important to keep good records of your gambling activity so that you can prove any deductions you claim if audited by the IRS.

#  Could Gambling Taxes Spell Trouble for Social Security?

The Social Security trust fund is already in trouble, with the program scheduled to run a deficit in 2020. [1]Now some experts are suggesting that gambling taxes could add to the program’s financial woes.

Americans spent $122.7 billion on legalized gambling in 2016, up from $119.9 billion in 2015. [2] That’s a lot of money, and it’s only going to keep growing as more states legalize gambling options like online poker and casino games.

Taxes on gambling winnings could bring in a lot of revenue for the government – but they could also come at the expense of Social Security. Gambling taxes are currently treated as ordinary income, which means they’re taxed at marginal rates that can reach as high as 39.6%. [3] That’s a lot higher than the 12.4% payroll tax that employees and employers pay on Social Security wages.

If gambling taxes continue to grow at the same rate as overall gambling spending, they could raise more than $10 billion per year within 10 years. [4] That would be a significant chunk of revenue, and it would likely come at the expense of Social Security funding.

Some experts are already calling for changes to how gambling taxes are treated, arguing that they should be considered capital gains instead of ordinary income. [5] Capital gains are taxed at lower rates, so if gambling taxes were reclassified in this way, it would save people a lot of money.

It’s too early to say for sure what will happen with gambling taxes and Social Security, but it’s definitely something to keep an eye on. If lawmakers don’t take action soon, the two programs could start competing for scarce resources.

#  Winners May Have to Pay Taxes on Gambling Winnings

In the United States, gambling winnings are considered taxable income. This means that the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) expects taxpayers to report and pay taxes on any money they earn from gambling activities.

There are a few exceptions to this rule. For example, gambling losses can be deducted from gambling winnings when calculating your taxable income. And certain types of gambling winnings – like those earned from horseracing – may be tax-free.

But in general, if you gamble and win, you’ll have to pay taxes on your profits.

How Much Do I Have to Pay?

The amount of tax you’ll owe on your gambling winnings depends on your federal income tax bracket. As of 2019, the federal income tax brackets are as follows:

10% for incomes below $9,700

12% for incomes between $9,701 and $39,475

22% for incomes between $39,476 and $84,200

24% for incomes between $84,201 and $157,500

32% for incomes between $157,501 and $200,000
_36%_ for incomes above $200,000.

So if you earn more than $157,501 in gambling winnings during a given year, you’ll owe 36% of those profits in taxes. And if you earn less than that threshold amount but more than $9,700, you’ll still owe 10% in taxes on your gambling income.


To calculate how much tax you owe on your gambling income specifically, use Form 1040 Schedule A line 28. This will give you the total amount of taxable income from all of your sources – including gambling profits. Then simply look up your corresponding tax bracket in the table above to find out how much you need to pay.

#  Taxing Gambling Winnings Could Hurt Social Security

The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) is considering a proposal to tax gambling winnings. This could have a negative impact on Social Security.

Gambling generates about $41 billion in revenue each year. The proposed tax would generate an additional $9 billion in revenue. However, this could come at a cost to Social Security.

Gamblers are more likely to have lower incomes than the general population. They are also more likely to lack insurance and other benefits. A tax on gambling winnings would further reduce their income and make it harder for them to afford basic necessities.

This could lead to increased poverty and reliance on government assistance programs, such as Social Security. Taxing gambling winnings could also lead to job losses in the gambling industry. This could further reduce income and increase poverty rates.

The proposed tax would also negatively impact states that rely on gambling revenue to support important programs and services. States like Nevada, West Virginia, and Louisiana rely heavily on gambling revenue to fund education, healthcare, and other critical programs.

Taxing gambling winnings is a bad idea that could have serious consequences for social security and state budgets.

#  Are You Ready to Pay Taxes on Your Social Security Wins?

The Social Security system in the United States is designed to help retirees and their families with a stream of income that can help make ends meet. However, there is one major downside to receiving Social Security benefits: you may have to pay taxes on those benefits.

# Figuring Out If You Have to Pay Taxes on Your Social Security

The first step in figuring out if you have to pay taxes on your Social Security is to determine how much money you received from the program in the previous year. Once you know how much money you received, look at your tax bracket to see if you have to pay taxes on it.

For example, if you are single and made less than $25,000 in 2017, then you don’t have to pay taxes on your Social Security benefits. However, if you made more than $85,000 as a single taxpayer in 2017, then you will have to pay taxes on at least some of your Social Security benefits.

# What Happens If You Have To Pay Taxes On Your Social Security?

If you have to pay taxes on your Social Security benefits, that doesn’t mean that all of your benefit payments will be taxed. Instead, only a certain amount of your benefits will be considered taxable income.

The amount that is considered taxable depends on how much money other people receive from retirement accounts and pensions. For example, if 50% of your combined retirement income is more than $25,000 (for singles), then 50% of your Social Security benefits will be considered taxable income.

# What Can You Do To Reduce The Amount of Taxes You Have To Pay On Your Social Security?

If you find out that you have to pay taxes on your Social Security benefits, there are a few things you can do to reduce the amount of taxes you have to pay. First, make sure that you take advantage of all available tax breaks, such as the Retirement Savings Contributions Credit or the Student Loan Interest Deduction.

You may also want to consider splitting your retirement income with a spouse so that only part of it is taxed. Finally, remember that there are several ways to withdraw money from your 401(k) or IRA without having to pay any taxes on it – so don’t be afraid to start taking withdrawals once you retire!

#  Learn How to Win Money with a Slot Machine 

Slot machines are one of the most popular casino games in the world. They are easy to play and can be quite profitable if you know how to win money with them. In this article, we will teach you the basics of playing slot machines and how to maximize your chances of winning.

The first thing you need to do is learn the different types of slots and choose the one that best suits your play style. There are three main types of slots: classic, video, and progressive. Classic slots have three reels and usually offer lower payouts than video or progressive slots. Video slots have five or more reels and often have bonus rounds and other special features that can increase your winnings. Progressive slots have a jackpot that grows with each bet until it is won. The best way to maximize your chances of winning on a progressive slot is to bet the maximum amount each spin.

Once you've chosen a slot machine, you need to learn how to play it. Most slot machines work the same way: you insert coins or bills into the machine, press a button to start spinning, and wait for the symbols on the reels to stop spinning. If you match three or more matching symbols on a payline, you win a prize depending on the payout schedule for that particular machine.

One of the most important things to remember when playing slot machines is that they are designed to give the house an edge over the player. This means that it is not possible to win money consistently by playing slot machines. However, with a little bit of luck and some strategic thinking, you can use slot machines as a way to make money while having fun.

Here are some tips for winning at slot machines:
- always read the payout schedule before playing so you know what symbols are worth the most money
- learn which combinations of symbols result in the biggest payouts
- always bet max credits when playing progressive slots in order to have a chance at winning the jackpot
- try out different machine styles until you find one that suits your betting style and preferences

#  Texas Holdem Cheat Sheet 

If you are new to the Texas Holdem game or just need a refresher on the basic rules, then this cheat sheet is for you. This guide covers the basics of how to play Texas Holdem as well as some of the most common hands and their ranking.

The basic rules of Texas Holdem are as follows: 

1) There are two rounds of betting - preflop and postflop.
2) A player is dealt two cards face down (hole cards).
3) The first round of betting takes place, with players deciding whether to open (bet), call (match the amount bet by the previous player), raise (double the amount bet by the previous player) or fold (quit the hand). 
4) Three communal cards are turned face up one at a time in a clockwise direction (the flop). Another round of betting takes place. 
5) A fourth communal card is turned face up - this is called the turn. Another round of betting takes place. 
6) The fifth and final communal card is turned over - this is called the river. Another round of betting takes place, with players now competing for the pot, which is made up of all the money put in by players during all rounds of betting. The player who has best hand according to standard poker rankings wins the pot. 

In Texas Holdem, there are 10 types of poker hands, from worst to best: high card, pair, two pairs, three of a kind, straight, flush, full house, four of a kind, straight flush and royal flush. In order to make a valid poker hand, you must use exactly two hole cards and three community cards. If using both hole cards results in more than one possible combination (e.g. two pairs), then your highest-ranking combination will be used (e.g. two pair becomes kings over fives). If using both hole cards results in no possible combinations (e.g. both are clubs), then your hand is considered a "high card" hand and ranked according to its highest-ranking card - for example if your highest-ranking card is an ace then your hand would be ranked as an ace high card hand.

#  Winning at Slot Machines is Simple with this Guide 
Slot machines are one of the most popular casino games, and they offer some of the best chances of winning big. However, many people lose money playing slot machines because they don't understand how they work. 

In this guide, we'll walk you through the basics of playing slot machines and show you how to win more often. We'll also give you some tips for avoiding common mistakes. 

The first thing to understand is that slot machines are a game of chance. There is no guaranteed way to win on them, and you can't predict which symbols will appear on the reels. However, there are some things you can do to improve your chances. 

One of the most important things is to choose a machine that's appropriate for your betting level. If you're betting low stakes, choose a machine with lower payout percentages. If you're betting high stakes, choose a machine with higher payout percentages. 

Another thing to keep in mind is that not all machines are created equal. Some machines have higher payout percentages than others. So, it's important to do your research before playing. You can find information about payout percentages at most online casinos. 

Once you've chosen a machine, it's important to know how to play it properly. The basic rules are simple: insert your coins or tokens into the machine, press the spin button, and wait for the reels to stop spinning. Depending on the symbols that appear on the reels, you could win money or lose money. 

One common mistake that people make is betting too much money on each spin. This can quickly lead to losses if you're not lucky. It's better to spread your bets over several spins so that you don't lose all your money in one go. 

Additionally, it's important to be patient and not rush your bets. Rushing can lead to mistakes and missed opportunities for winning payouts. So take your time, relax, and let the chips fall where they may.

#  Use this Texas Holdem Cheat Sheet for Maximum Winnings 

In Texas Hold'em, your goal is simple - make the best 5 card poker hand from the 7 cards you are dealt. There are numerous different ways to make a winning hand, and the best hand doesn't always win.

Before the flop (the first 3 community cards), there are 1,326 different ways to make a hand. After the flop, that number increases to 3,744. That's a lot of potential hands!

There are a few hands that you should always be on the lookout for though. Here are the top 10 hands in Texas Hold'em, in order of strength:

1. Royal Flush 
2. Straight Flush 
3. Four of a Kind 
4. Full House 
5. Flush 
6. Straight 
7. Three of a Kind 
8. Two Pair 
9. One Pair 
10. High Card

#  Get Ahead of Your Competition with this Slot Machine Strategy

There are many slot machine strategies that gamblers can use to give themselves an edge. However, there is one strategy that is consistently overlooked: betting strategies. By using the right betting strategy, you can get ahead of your competition and increase your chances of winning. In this article, we will discuss different betting strategies that you can use and how to implement them.

The first betting strategy is the Martingale system. This system is popular among roulette players, and it can also be used for slots. The basic premise of the Martingale system is that you double your bet after every loss until you win. For slots, this would mean that you would bet $2 after each loss until you won. Then, you would start over with your original bet amount. The disadvantage of this system is that you can lose a lot of money if you don’t win soon enough.

Another popular betting strategy is the Parlay system. With Parlay betting, you make multiple bets on a single spin and if all of your bets win, then your payout is multiplied by the number of bets that won. This system can be very lucrative if you have a good hunch about which slots to play, but it also carries with it a higher risk than other systems.

One final betting strategy to consider is the Flat Betting strategy. With Flat Betting, you simply bet the same amount on each spin. This reduces your chances of losing big money but it also doesn’t provide as much potential for gain as some of the other systems.

Which betting strategy you choose will depend on your own personal goals and gambling style. However, using one or more of these systems can give you a better chance of winning at slots and beating your competition!

The Oakland Athletics are a professional baseball team based in Oakland, California. They are a member of the Western Division of Major League Baseball's American League. The Athletics have played in their current home ballpark, the Oakland–Alameda County Coliseum since 1968.

1. Pay attention to statistics – When betting on baseball, always take into account the important statistics for each team. Things such as batting average, earned run average (ERA), and runs scored can give you a good indication of which team is likely to win.

2. Look at recent performances – Be sure to also look at how each team has been performing lately. This will help you determine if there is any recent momentum that could carry over into the game you're betting on.

3. Consider the odds – Always make sure to compare the odds between different sportsbooks before placing a bet. This will ensure that you're getting the best possible payout on your bet.

4. Bet on underdogs – In general, it's usually advisable to bet on the underdog in baseball games. The payouts tend to be higher, and they offer more potential for upsets than favourites do.

5. Use hedging – If you're confident in your pick but still want some protection in case things don't go your way, consider using hedging techniques. This will allow you to cut your losses if your initial pick ends up losing while still giving you a chance to win big if it comes through in the end.

6. Avoid parlays – Parlays are a bets involving multiple teams, and they tend to have very low odds of winning. As such, it's generally not advisable to use them when betting on baseball games.

7. Know your limits – It's important not to overbet when betting on baseball games, especially if you're new to the sport. Start out by betting small amounts until you get a feel for how things work, and then gradually increase your bets as you become more comfortable with the process.

8. Watch out for traps – There are occasions when one team is heavily favored over another, but this doesn't necessarily mean that the favored team is guaranteed to win. #  Mayweather vs. McGregor: What does 2500 mean in sports betting?

In the world of sports betting, there are so many different types of bets that can be made. Whether it be on the outcome of a game, how many points will be scored, or even who will win a particular matchup, there is always something for everyone. With the Mayweather vs. McGregor fight quickly approaching, one particular type of bet that is gaining in popularity is the 2500 bet.

So what exactly is a 2500 bet? Put simply, it is a wager placed on whether the total number of points scored in the game by both teams will be either over or under 2500. This type of bet can be placed on individual games or on entire seasons, and can provide some excellent payouts depending on the odds at the time of placing the bet.

For example, let's say that you believe that there will be a lot of scoring in the Mayweather vs. McGregor fight, and that both teams are likely to exceed 2500 points between them. You could place a 2500 bet on this outcome, and if you are correct then you would stand to win a significant payout. Alternatively, if you think that this matchup is going to be relatively low-scoring and that neither side will reach 2500 points, then you could place a 2500 bet on the under. If this happens, then you would collect your payout even if the final score is only 2499 points or lower.

As you can see, betting on 2500 can be an excellent way to add an extra layer of excitement to any game or match-up. With such high potential payouts available, it's no wonder that more and more people are starting to take interest in this type of wager. So why not give it a try yourself? Just make sure you do your research first and get acquainted with the latest odds before placing your bet.

#  Mayweather undefeated streak continues with win over McGregor

In one of the most highly anticipated boxing matches in recent memory, Floyd Mayweather defeated Conor McGregor on Saturday night in Las Vegas. The undefeated Mayweather was a heavy favorite coming into the fight, and he lived up to expectations, winning by TKO in the 10th round.

Mayweather's record now stands at 50-0, and many are already calling for him to retire. McGregor, who had never boxed before this fight, put up a respectable effort but was ultimately outmatched by the more experienced Mayweather.

For fans of either fighter, the bout was a disappointment. Mayweather largely played defensive and avoided taking too much risk, while McGregor lacked the power to put any significant damage on his opponent. In the end, it was a fairly tame affair that failed to produce the fireworks many had hoped for.

The one major highlight of the fight came in the 10th round when Mayweather finally landed a series of powerful shots that sent McGregor stumbling backwards across the ring. McGregor was clearly hurt, and after taking a few more shots from Mayweather, the referee stepped in to stop the fight.

In an interview after the fight, McGregor said that he was "absolutely gutted" but conceded that Mayweather was "the better man tonight." He also announced his retirement from professional fighting, saying that he is now "looking forward to something else."

Mayweather also spoke after the fight, saying that he plans to retire as champion with an unblemished record. "I think this was my last fight," he said. "It was a great career."

While it may not have been an exciting contest, Mayweather's victory over McGregor will go down as yet another impressive milestone in his legendary career.

#  What does 2500 mean in sports betting for the Premier League?

2500 in Premier League betting is the equivalent of a £25 bet. When placing a bet, this number refers to the total amount that will be wagered. This figure may change depending on the odds offered by the sportsbook.

Generally, when it comes to football betting, 2500 refers to a medium-sized wager. For instance, a bettor might make this type of bet with four different selections (each at £625) rather than putting all his eggs in one basket.

This amount can also be used when betting on accumulators. An accumulator is a series of bets that are placed on several teams or outcomes, with the hope that all selections will win. When using 2500 as the stake for an accumulator, it means the total potential payout if all selections are successful would be £62500 (2500 x 25).

However, it's important to remember that not all accumulators will result in a payout and even if they do, the amount returned may not be equal to 2500 times the original stake. This is because bookmakers offer different odds on different outcomes, so depending on how many selections are successful and what those odds are, payouts can vary greatly.

So while 2500 can be seen as a medium-sized wager in Premier League betting, it's important to remember that this number can vary greatly depending on the individual bet and the sportsbook being used.

#  Dodgers up against it after losing game 5 to Cubs

The Dodgers were up against it after losing game 5 to the Cubs and falling behind in the series 3-2. Things looked bleak for them, but they pulled through and won game 6 to force a seventh game. They then went on to win the seventh game and advance to the next round of the playoffs.

Their victory was due in part to the great performance of Clayton Kershaw. He pitched brilliantly in game 6, allowing just one run over seven innings while striking out ten batters. This was an impressive comeback from his poor performance in game 5, when he allowed four runs over six innings.

The Dodgers will now face the Washington Nationals in the National League Championship Series. The Nationals are a tough opponent, but if Kershaw can pitch like he did in games 6 and 7, the Dodgers have a chance of winning.

#  McGregor makes a comeback in round 10

After a 10-month layoff, mixed martial artist Conor McGregor made a successful comeback to the UFC with a win over Nate Diaz in their rematch at UFC 202 on Saturday.

 McGregor started slowly in the octagon and Diaz appeared to be taking control of the fight, but the Irishman came back strongly in the last two rounds to secure a victory with a majority decision from the judges.

The win was crucial for McGregor, as he looks to set up a megafight against Brazilian champion Jose Aldo, who is currently the undisputed featherweight champion.

The pair were scheduled to fight last December, but Aldo pulled out of the bout due to an injury.

#  How to Play Algerian Poker

#

If you want to try a new type of poker, Algerian poker might be the game for you. This variant is played with a regular deck of 52 cards, and the goal is to make the best five-card hand possible. Here's how to play:

# The Basics

To begin, each player is dealt two cards face down, and one card face up. The face-up card is called the door card. The player with the highest door card begins the action, and play passes clockwise around the table.

# Betting Rounds

On a player's turn, they can either bet or fold. If they choose to bet, they must put in at least as much as the previous bet (or raise). If they fold, they forfeit their hand and cannot rejoin the hand later.

After all players have had a chance to bet, the dealer flips over the next three cards (the flop). These are communal cards that everyone can use to make their hand. Players now have two more chances to bet - one after the first card on the turn (the fourth card), and one after the second card on the turn (the fifth and final card). Betting rounds continue in this way until all players have either folded or put in the same amount of money. At this point, whoever has the best five-card hand wins!

#  History of Algerian Poker

The game of poker is believed to have originated from a 16th century Persian game called as Nas, which was then introduced to France by the soldiers of Napoleon Bonaparte. There are several versions of how poker came to be played in Algeria, but the most popular story is that it was brought over by French colonists in the early 1800s.

Algerian poker is a variation of the traditional French game that is played with a 40-card deck, instead of the standard 52 cards. The game is typically played by four players in two partnerships, with each player receiving five cards. The aim of the game is to score points by making combinations of cards, similar to other card games like bridge or whist.

One point is scored for each Ace, two points for each king, three points for each queen and four points for each jack. The 10, 9 and 8 cards are worth zero points. The player who takes the last trick also scores one point. The first team to reach 10 points wins the game.

There are several variations of Algerian poker, but the most popular version is known as Matwess or "half hearts". In this version, Aces are worth one point, kings two points, queens three points and jacks four points. The 10, 9 and 8 cards are worth zero points. If a player has no more cards in their hand at the end of a trick, they can still take it and score a point.

Algerian Poker has been enjoyed by people all over the world for centuries and continues to be a favourite choice amongst card players today.

#  Types of Algerian Poker

There are different types of Algerian poker that people can play. However, the two most common types of Algerian poker are Belote and Rami.

Belote is a game that is played with 32 cards. The aim of the game is to score points by taking tricks. The player who takes the last trick in the hand also scores points for their team. In order to win, a team must score at least 100 points.

Rami is a game that is played with either 36 or 52 cards. The aim of the game is to score points by taking tricks. The player who takes the last trick in the hand also scores points for their team. In order to win, a team must score at least 200 points.

#  Winning at Algerian Poker

*

It's always great to have a new game to play, and poker is one of the most exciting games around. If you're looking for a new challenge, why not try Algerian Poker? This unique variation of poker is sure to test your skills and provide hours of fun.

*

Algerian Poker is played with a standard deck of 52 cards. The game is played in turns, with each player being dealt five cards. The aim of the game is to make the best five-card hand possible using two of your own cards and three of the community cards.

*

The player with the strongest hand at the end of the game wins. If there is a tie, the player with the highest card in their hand wins. The first player to lose all their chips loses the game.

*

There are a number of different betting rounds in Algerian Poker, which makes the game even more exciting. In addition, there are a number of different bets that you can place during the course of the game. This includes both inside and outside bets.

Post.title: Mariners acquire Felix Hernandez from the Tigers in exchange for two green poker chips
Post._content:
#  Mariners acquire Felix Hernandez from the Tigers in exchange for two green poker chips

In a move that shocked the baseball world, the Mariners acquired Felix Hernandez from the Tigers in exchange for two green poker chips.

"This is an amazing deal for the Mariners," said GM Jerry Dipoto. "We're getting one of the best pitchers in baseball for just two green poker chips. We're going to be a real contender in the AL West this year."

Hernandez, who is entering his age-30 season, has a career record of 148-98 and a 3.53 ERA. He is a six-time All-Star and has won three Cy Young Awards.

"I'm excited to be joining the Mariners," Hernandez said. "I think we can do some big things this year."

The Tigers, who are in rebuilding mode, were looking to acquire young talent and decided to trade Hernandez for two green poker chips.

"We're very happy with this deal," said Tigers GM Al Avila. "We got a great pitcher in return for just two green poker chips."

#  Rangers and Astros bury the hatchet, agree to share the green poker chip value

Houston, TX - 

In a move that celebrates the camaraderie of baseball and good-natured ribbing between division rivals, the Rangers and Astros have announced an agreement to evenly split the value of the green poker chip. The chip, which has been a source of contention between the two clubs since it was first introduced by then-Rangers manager Ron Washington in 2009, was originally worth $100 but has since accrued (inflation) to a value of over $1,000.

"It's always been our hope that we could come to an agreement with the Astros on this matter," said Rangers GM Jon Daniels. "There's no question that the chip is more valuable to us, but we're happy to share in its history and tradition with our friends in Houston."

"It's a great thing for both clubs," added Astros GM Jeff Luhnow. "We're really proud of the chip and how it's come to represent our rivalry. Now we can all enjoy it together."

The announcement marks a resolution to one of the longest-running disputes in MLB history and provides closure for fans on both sides of the Lone Star State.

#  A's fire manager Bob Melvin, citing his inability to win with a green poker chip

The A's announced today that they have fired manager Bob Melvin, citing his inability to win with a green poker chip.

"We gave it our best shot," said team owner John Fisher. "But we just can't seem to win with a green poker chip. We need to go in a different direction."

Fisher would not say who the team is targeting as their new manager, but rumors are swirling that they may be interested in former Yankees manager Joe Girardi.

"Joe is a proven winner, and we believe he could lead our team to a World Series championship," said Fisher. "He's at the top of our list, and we're hoping to make a decision soon."

Girardi, who was fired by the Yankees after the 2017 season, has not yet commented on the A's offer.

#  Mariners sign free agent Yusei Kikuchi to a six-year, $126 million contract

The Seattle Mariners have agreed to a six-year, $126 million contract with free agent left-handed pitcher Yusei Kikuchi, according to multiple reports.

Kikuchi, 27, spent last season with the Seibu Lions in Japan's Nippon Professional Baseball League, where he went 14-6 with a 3.08 ERA and 191 strikeouts in 170 innings. He was reportedly pursued by more than 10 teams this offseason.

"We are excited to welcome Yusei to Seattle," Mariners general manager Jerry Dipoto said in a statement. "His abilities on the mound match up well with our players and coaching staff and we believe his style of play will fit well in Safeco Field. We look forward to him joining our organization and helping us compete for championships."

The Mariners will forfeit their second-highest draft pick this year as compensation for signing Kikuchi, whose signing is still pending a physical exam.

Kikuchi represents the latest high-profile addition to the Mariners' roster this offseason, following the signings of Japanese shortstop Hiroyuki Nakajima and catcher Robinson Cano.

#  Angels release Mike Trout, stating that they can no longer afford him

The Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim released superstar outfielder Mike Trout today, citing their inability to afford his $432 million contract demands.

"It's with a heavy heart that we must say goodbye to Mike," said team owner Arte Moreno. "He has been an incredible player and ambassador for the Angels, but unfortunately we just can't afford him anymore."

The news comes as a shock to baseball fans around the world, as Trout is widely considered the best player in the game. He has won six Silver Slugger awards, four MVPs, and two World Series championships in his ten-year career with the Angels.

"I'm sad to see Mike go, but I wish him all the best in his next chapter," said Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw. "He's going to be missed in Angel Stadium, that's for sure."

Trout is expected to sign with one of the many teams who have expressed interest in him, including the Philadelphia Phillies, New York Yankees, and Chicago Cubs.

The answer to this question is simply no. It's impossible to win blackjack by book every time because the house always has the advantage in this game. However, there are techniques that you can use to improve your chances of winning.

One such technique is card counting. When done correctly, card counting can help you reduce the casino's edge and increase your chances of winning. Another technique that can help you improve your odds is basic strategy. This involves making smart decisions about when to hit, stand, double down, or split your cards.

#  How Often Do You Win at Blackjack by Book?

Whether you're a beginner or an experienced blackjack player, you've probably wondered how often the casino will beat you. The answer, of course, depends on both your playing strategy and the particular rules at the casino where you're playing. But here are some general guidelines to help you get started.

The most important factor in determining how often you'll win at blackjack is the house edge. This is the percentage of each bet that the casino expects to keep over the long run, regardless of the particular game or betting strategy used. For example, if the house edge is 1%, then the casino expects to keep 1% of every bet made, on average.

Lowering the house edge is essential to improving your odds at blackjack. You can do this by finding casinos with better rules (such as those that don't hit soft 17) or by using a better betting strategy (such as basic strategy). But no matter what you do, you'll never get rid of the house edge completely - it's simply impossible. The best you can hope for is to reduce it as much as possible.

This means that for every $100 you wager, you can expect to lose about $1 on average.

However, this doesn't mean that you'll lose every time - in fact, you could quite easily walk away with a profit over time. But it does mean that the casino has a statistical advantage over players, and that's why they always make money in the end.

The goal when playing blackjack is to beat the dealer's hand without going over 21. In this article, we will discuss some of the most successful strategies for playing blackjack.

One of the most important things to keep in mind when playing blackjack is that you should always try to split your cards if you have two cards of the same value. For example, if you are dealt two eights, you should split them and play each card as a separate hand. This increases your chances of beating the dealer's hand.

#  Hold'em Cheat Sheet for Sale: How to Win at Texas Poker

This comprehensive hold'em cheat sheet will teach you how to win at Texas poker. It covers all the basics, from learning the hand rankings to betting strategy. You'll also find a section on advanced tactics, including bluffing and reading your opponents. So whether you're a beginner or a seasoned pro, this cheat sheet has something for you.

## The Basics

In Texas hold'em, there are two main rounds of betting - preflop and postflop. In the preflop round, each player is dealt two cards (hole cards), and then there's a round of betting. After the preflop betting is complete, three community cards are revealed (the flop), and another round of betting takes place. Then a fourth community card (the turn) is revealed, followed by one final round of betting. The player who holds the best five-card poker hand after the final round of betting wins the pot.

In order to make the best possible hand, you'll need to use both of your hole cards and three of the community cards. Here are the basic hands in order from strongest to weakest:

- Royal flush: Aces through kings, all of the same suit
- Straight flush: Five consecutive cards of the same suit
- Four of a kind: Four cards of the same rank
- Full house: Three cards of one rank and two cards of another rank
- Flush: Five cards of the same suit, not in sequence
- Straight: Five consecutive cards not all in the same suit
- Three of a kind: Three cards of the same rank
- Two pair: Two different pairs
- One pair: Two cards of the same rank
- High card: The highest ranking card in your hand

#  Magnetic Bingo Snacks – a Fun Way to Play Bingo and Eat Delicious Treats

Magnetic bingo snacks are a fun way to play the game of bingo and to eat delicious treats. They are made out of small squares of cardboard that have a pattern of magnetic dots on them. There is a magnet in the middle of each dot. The dots are attached to a metal bar that is divided into five equal parts. This bar is attached to a handle, which makes it easy to spin the dots around.

When you are playing bingo with magnetic bingo snacks, you place the snack in the middle of your row of numbers. Then, you use the magnet on the end of the handle to spin the dots around. You can stop them at any time by pressing down on top of them. If all of the dots in a row are magnetic, then you have Bingo!

The great thing about magnetic bingo snacks is that they are delicious as well as fun to play with. You can choose from a variety of different flavors, including vanilla, strawberry, and chocolate. Plus, there is no need for any pens or paper when you are playing bingo with these snacks – just use the magnets on the handle to keep track of your progress!

#  Texas Hold'em Cheat Sheet: How to Win at Poker Tournaments

Texas Hold'em is a popular poker game that can be enjoyed by players of all skill levels. However, if you're looking to win at poker tournaments, you'll need to know the basics of the game as well as some advanced strategies.

1. Know the Poker Hand Rankings

The first step to winning at poker tournaments is knowing the rankings of hands in poker. In general, the higher the rank of a hand, the better it is. Here are the rankings of hands from worst to best:

2. Play Tight and Limit Your Betting

One of the most important things to remember when playing poker tournaments is to play tight and limit your betting. This means that you should only play strong hands and avoid making risky bets. By playing tight, you'll minimize your chances of losing money and increase your odds of winning pots.

3. Use Positioning to Your Advantage

Positioning is another important factor to consider when playing poker tournaments. Specifically, you'll want to use your position at the table to your advantage. For example, if you're one of the later players to act (known as late position), you'll have more information about what other players are holding than players who are acting earlier (known as early position). This gives you an advantage when it comes time to make decisions about whether or not to bet or fold.

4. Bet When You Have the Edge

Another key strategy for winning at poker tournaments is betting when you have the edge over your opponents. In other words, don't bet when you don't have a good hand - only bet when you think you have the best hand. This will help you win more pots and increase your chances of winning the tournament overall.

Post._content:
#  A's Discourage Gambling on their Games

A's management have been discouraging gambling on their games for years, but their recent actions seem to suggest that they are taking the matter more seriously. Gambling on baseball games is a popular pastime, but it can also be a risky investment. A's management has been clear that they do not condone gambling on their games and will take measures to prevent it.

In the past, the A's have taken measures such as refusing to release betting information to the public and prohibiting people from wagering on their games at the stadium. Recently, they have stepped up their efforts by revoking the credentials of several reporters who were caught gambling on A's games. This sends a clear message that A's management takes this issue seriously and is not going to tolerate gambling on their games.

Gambling can be fun, but it can also be risky. When you gamble on sports, you are essentially investing in an uncertain outcome. There is no guaranteed way to make money when gambling on sports, which is why it is important to only invest what you can afford to lose.

If you are thinking about betting on baseball, make sure you do your research first. Look at the odds and see if they are in your favor. Also, think about how much you are willing to lose if things don't go your way. If you follow these tips, you should be able to enjoy gambling on baseball without putting yourself at risk.

#  Athletics Looking to Limit Sports Betting Throughout Mississippi

 Mississippi state lawmakers are looking to place a limit on how much money can be gambled on sporting events in the state. A bill has been proposed in the legislature that would cap sports betting at $2,500 per person annually. 

The move is an effort to protect the integrity of athletics and to prevent any undue influences that could come with widespread sports betting. Representative Toby Barker, who introduced the bill, commented on the matter, saying “It’s not about making it harder for people to bet on games; it’s about making sure we have an even playing field as far as gambling goes. Gambling on games already happens, but by legalizing it and putting a cap on how much people can bet, we can make sure everyone is playing by the same rules.” 

Opponents of the bill argue that it would be a major blow to casino revenues in the state and would lead to job losses. However, supporters believe that the benefits of preventing corruption in sports and protecting consumers outweigh any potential losses. 

This issue is sure to be debated heavily in the coming months as Mississippi lawmakers look to pass a comprehensive gambling reform bill.

#  A's Hope to Quell Rumors of Sports Gambling in Mississippi

The Oakland Athletics have been dealing with rumors of their involvement in sports gambling in the state of Mississippi for weeks now. The allegations surfaced after it was discovered that an A's employee had been funneling money to a sports betting organization based out of the state. The employee has since been fired, and the A's front office is doing everything they can to clear their name and put this issue to rest.

"We want to make it clear that we do not condone any type of sports gambling," said Athletics' General Manager David Forst. "This employee's actions were completely unacceptable, and we are doing everything we can to cooperate with the authorities as they investigate this matter."

Athletics' CEO Anthony Levandowski echoed those sentiments, saying, "This is not how we conduct our business. We have zero tolerance for this type of behavior, and we are doing everything we can to get to the bottom of it."

While the Athletics may be trying to distance themselves from the allegations, some fans are not convinced. Some are even calling for the team's owner, John Fisher, to sell the team.

"I'm not going to stop rooting for the A's, but I think it would be best if Fisher sold the team," said fan Keith Hargrove. "He needs to get rid of all the shady characters and start fresh."

Others are standing by the team, believing that they will be cleared of any wrongdoing.

"I have faith that the A's didn't do anything wrong," said fan Bethany Garza. "They're a good team with good values, and I believe they'll come out on top in this situation."

The Athletics will hope to put this issue behind them as they continue their quest for a World Series championship.

#  Oakland Athletics Trying to Stop Illegal Sports Betting in Mississippi

Since the legalization of sports betting in Mississippi, the Oakland Athletics have been trying to stop illegal sports betting in the state. The Athletics are concerned about the impact of legalized sports betting on the integrity of their game.

The Athletics have been working with state officials to develop regulations that will protect the integrity of sporting events in Mississippi. They are also working with law enforcement officials to crack down on illegal sports betting operations in the state.

The legalization of sports betting has created a new revenue stream for the state of Mississippi. However, it is important to ensure that the integrity of sporting events is not compromised by this new industry. The Oakland Athletics are playing a lead role in ensuring that this happens.

#  Athletics Oppose Sports Betting Expansion in their Hometown

In the wake of the US Supreme Court's repeal of a federal law that prohibited states from authorizing sports gambling, some professional sports leagues and individual franchises have lobbied state governments to not expand betting. The National Football League, Major League Baseball, and the National Basketball Association, as well as several team owners in those leagues, have made their stance clear in recent months.

Athletics franchises are included in that group. The Oakland Athletics and Golden State Warriors, who share a hometown and stadium, both oppose expanding sports betting in California. "We don't want to see sports betting proliferate," said A's President Dave Kaval in an interview with The Sacramento Bee. "It could lead to more corruption in our games."

Governor Jerry Brown is considering a proposal to allow sports betting in California as part of an expansion of gambling in the state. Brown has until the end of September to make a decision on the proposal. If he signs it into law, California would join Nevada as one of the few states where betting on sporting events is legal.

The A's and Warriors aren't alone among Bay Area sports teams in their opposition to expanded betting. The San Francisco Giants and 49ers have also spoken out against it, as has Santa Clara County Supervisor Cindy Chavez, who represents the home of Levi's Stadium, which hosts both 49ers home games and Super Bowl LIII next year.

"I just think it's really important that we keep our youth away from gambling," Chavez said at a news conference last month. "It's something that is very dangerous for our communities."

#  How to Know When to Hit and Split in Blackjack Table

There is a constant debate on when to hit and split in blackjack tables. Many people think that it is a simple decision, but there are actually many factors to consider before making the choice. The following guide will help you understand when it is the best time to make those moves.

The goal of blackjack is to score 21 points with your first two cards or come as close as possible without going over. In order to achieve this, players must first decide whether or not to hit or stand based on the total of their cards. For example, if you have a five and a six, your total is 11 so you would want to hit in order to try and get a card that adds up to 21.

However, if you have an ace and a four, your total is fifteen which is too high to hit. In this case, you would want to stand since you don’t want to go over 21. If you have twoof the same number such as two eights, then you can split them into two separate hands.

When splitting, be sure to place another bet equal to the amount of your original bet. This will create two new hands that will be played out separately. The following are some general guidelines on when it is best to hit or split:

-Hit if your hand total is less than 12
-Split if your hand total is either 8 or greater OR if the dealer has an Ace showing
-Hit if the dealer has a 2 through 7 card showing
-Stand if the dealer has an 8 through Ace card showing

#  The Best Time to Hit and Split in Blackjack Table

There are different times you can hit and split in blackjack, and it’s important to know when they are in order to make the most money possible. We’ll go over all of them in this article.

The first time to hit and split is when you have a hand of two cards that total nine or less. This includes hands like an Ace and a six, or a two and a seven. In these situations, you should always hit because you have a good chance of getting another card that will give you a better hand.

The next time to hit and split is when you have a hand of two cards that total 10 or 11. In these situations, you should only hit if the dealer is showing an Ace, 2, 3, 4, 5, or 6. If the dealer is showing anything else, then you should split your cards. This will give you two separate hands that each have a good chance of winning.

The last time to hit and split is when you have a hand of two cards that total 12-16. In these situations, you should hit if the dealer is showing 2-6. If the dealer is showing anything else, then you should split your cards. This will give you two separate hands that each have a good chance of winning.

The goal is to get as close to 21 as possible, without going over. The player is dealt two cards, and the dealer is dealt two cards, one face up and one face down. The player can either hit (take another card) or stand (end their turn). If the player goes over 21, they lose automatically. The winner is the person who has the highest total score, without going over 21.

The second step to winning at blackjack is learning basic strategy. This involves making correct decisions based on the two cards you are dealt and the dealer's upcard. The first step to winning at blackjack is learning the basic rules of the game. Blackjack is played with one or more decks of 52 cards. The goal is to get as close to 21 as possible, without going over. The player is dealt two cards, and the dealer is dealt two cards, one face up and one face down. The player can either hit (take another card) or stand (end their turn). If the player goes over 21, they lose automatically. The winner is the person who has the highest total score, without going over 21.

The second step to winning at blackjack is learning basic strategy. This involves making correct decisions based on the two cards you are dealt and the dealer’s upcard. For example, if you are dealt an Ace and a 10, you should hit because you have a total of 11. If you are dealt an Ace and a 2, you should double down (double your bet and take one more card). There are many other scenarios that require different decisions, but basic strategy will give you a good starting point.
